frame.name: Withdraw_from_participation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An individual that is scheduled to be a <fen>Participant</fen>, or already is a <fen>Participant</fen> in an <fen>Activity</fen> or an <fen>Organization</fen>, indicates that they will no not or no longer participate in that <fen>Activity</fen> or <fen>Organization</fen>. Note that the <fen>Organization</fen> often is one that is constituted by a treaty or agreement.
<ex><fex name="Participant">The Moslem contingent</fex> had <t>withdrawn</t> <fex name="Activity">from the EC talks</fex> <fex name="Time">on May 27</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Participant">The right-wing nationalist Tsomet Party</fex> formally <t>withdrew</t> <fex name="Organization">from the ruling coalition</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or individuals that are engaged or are scheduled to be engaged in an <fen>Activity</fen>.
<ex>Instead, <fex name="par">he</fex> was challenged by Neil Gaudry, and <t>withdrew</t> from the race when it appeared that he would not be victorious.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Activity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The event that the Participant is engaged in or was scheduled to be engaged in.
<ex> In any event , in mid-April he <t>withdrew</t> <fex name="act">from the contest</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the withdrawing event logically follows.
<ex>Washington says it <t>withdrew</t> from the agreement <fex name="exp">because Pyongyang admitted to secretly developing nuclear weapons</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Participant ends the participation in the Activity.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Participant ends their participation in the Activity.
</def-root>

FE.name: Organization
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Organization</fen> is an intentionally formed human social group with some definite structure to which the <fen>Participant</fen> belongs.
<ex>This led to the decision to <t>withdraw</t> <fex name="org">from IMF agreements</fex> in May 1987 .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Participant</fen> hopes to bring about by withdrawing</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The act done by the <fen>Participant</fen> that accomplishes their withdrawal.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>The document that the <fen>Participant</fen> uses to communicate their withdrawal.
<ex><fex name="med">In a memorandum dated May 6</fex>, they withdrew from the NPT.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>A description of the attitude of the <fen>Participant</fen> which also affects the character of the withdrawal.
<ex>After that, she <fex name="man">gladly</fex> <t>withdrew</t> from the match.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: withdraw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cease to participate in an activity or be a member of a team or organization.

lexUnit.name: withdrawal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of ending participation in an activity or being a member of a team or organization

lexUnit.name: beg off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: withdraw from a promise or undertaking.
